item.title: Narrow but deep pothole about 1ft away from pavement, 19th September
item.description:
Near to the telegraph pole and lamppost
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 176, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole near junction Bafford approach/ Cirenceter RD, 19th September
item.description:
Heading from Lidl towards Cheltenham is on the left hand side of the Cirencester Rd by the junction of Bafford App. It is approximately level with the left turn off . It is a small manhole or tap cover with the surrounding tarmac failing. When it rains it fills up with water and car and cycles have to avoid it. This was reported in April and fixed at the time which has clearly since failed again, so can a proper fix more permanent fix be put in place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bafford Approach, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed road edge in 2 places on New Road, near Two Hedges., 19th September
item.description:
Between New Road sink hole traffic lights and Two Hedges 2 separate road edges have collapsed. One is more sunken than other. Repairs have previously been made but edges need supporting as it will keep happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unnecessary temp lights, 19th September
item.description:
The temp lights had been there for over a month and no one is doing anything there. This is a main road connecting two towns, and it is always busy. There is traffic jam constantly. Not only people have to waist time being stuck in traffic, but this is not good for environment as well. How long is it going to be like that? Please send me an update.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 19th September
item.description:
Boundary of your land with Wendlescliffe Development. Foot of Evesham road, Bishopâ€™s Cleeve. GL52 8FU The boundary in question is at the back of the estate, at the end of Valentine road. ///stored.spun.inspector There are large tree branches overhanging our development along the boundary. Our maintenance contractors do not cut back at height. Some of the trees are willows and are susceptible to snapping. This will cause damage if it happens.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge is damaged/missing problem, 19th September
item.description:
Golf course bridge needs a safety "kick plank" which is missing. Dogs and people could easily slip into the brook. What 3 Words: breeding.resides.argue This bridge is located on footpath ECN1, a few hundred metres northwest (downstream) of Halfway Bridge, the first footbridge one comes to on Normans Brook.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 19th September
item.description:
16/09/24 email rcvd ::: On Saturday at the junction of Cheltenham Road and Old Cheltenham Road a large van travelling toward Longlevens on Cheltenham Road drove at speed ignoring the single No Entry Sign into Old Cheltenham Road causing a car travelling on Old Cheltenham Road toward Cheltenham Road to brake and swerve. I walked to the No Entry Sign to find it had been replaced with a new one which is too high and near a tree, you need to lower it and put a second sign to the left to make it obvious.
Report on FixMyStreet
